gw.document
Class DocumentContentsInfo

java.lang.Object
  gw.document.DocumentContentsInfo
Direct Known Subclasses:
DocumentContentsInfo
public class DocumentContentsInfo
extends java.lang.Object

Class encapsulating the response from either a document creation or document retrieval request. The idea here is that document contents may be made accessible to the UI through three possible mechanisms:

  • Raw document contents
  • HTML content which, when rendered through a browser, will cause the document to be displayed
  • JScript content which, when run on the client, will cause the document to be displayed
  • A URL which, when accessed by the user, will cause the document to be displayed
This class contains information letting the UI code know which of the types of response it is, and providing the relevant information for the given response type.

Author:
bjohnson

responseType - The type of response (document contents, html, or url)

mimeType - MIME type of the content

Method Detail

getDocumentContents

public static DocumentContentsInfo getDocumentContents(java.lang.String strDocUID,
                                                       java.lang.String contentMode,
                                                       java.lang.String contentURL,
                                                       java.lang.String documentURL,
                                                       java.lang.String documentsDir,
                                                       java.lang.String demoDocumentsDir,
                                                       boolean targetHiddenFrame,
                                                       boolean includeContents)
Builds the DocumentContentsInfo containing the document contents information. Most of the code in this method exists for the testing-time "mode" parameter; see the CONTENT_MODE section for the standard content-returning scenario.

Parameters:
strDocUID - The DocUID of the document whose contents should be returned
contentMode - the mode of the content, this can be #CONTENT_MODE, #URL_MODE, or #HTML_MODE
contentURL - URL of the content if it is URL mode
documentURL - URL of the document if it is CONTENT_MODE or HTML_MODE
documentsDir - documents directory for retrieving the content
demoDocumentsDir - Backup directory for retrieving the content, this is used for demo purpose
includeContents - If true, the actual contents of the document should be included in the DocumentContentsInfo
targetHiddenFrame - true if the target is a hidden frame
Returns:
A DocumentContentsInfo object with the metadata of the Document Contents, and possibly the contents themselves

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
Returns:
A Stream containing the value of the response

setResponseMimeType

public void setResponseMimeType(java.lang.String responseMimeType)
Parameters:
responseMimeType - The mime type of the value of the response. This should be either the mime type of the document itself if the response is returning document contents, or the appropriate mime type of the web content. For URL responses this value is not meaningful.

getResponseMimeType

public java.lang.String getResponseMimeType()
Returns:
The mime type of the value of the response. This will be either the mime type of the document itself if the response is returning document contents, or the appropriate mime type of the web content. For URL responses this value is not meaningful.

setTargetHiddenFrame

public void setTargetHiddenFrame(boolean targetHiddenFrame)
Parameters:
targetHiddenFrame - This should be set to true for web page or url contents if the UI should render them using a hidden frame in the browser, for example if the web page being returned contains javascript to pop up another page with the real document contents. For document contents responses, this will not be meaningful.

isTargetHiddenFrame

public boolean isTargetHiddenFrame()
Returns:
True for web page or url contents if the UI should render them using a hidden frame in the browser, for example if the web page being returned contains javascript to pop up another page with the real document contents. False otherwise. For document contents responses, this will not be meaningful.

getResponseType

public DocumentContentsInfo.ContentResponseType getResponseType()
Returns:
A constant indicating the type of response.
